channel.title: My lame IP pinger [BATCH]
channel.description:
[code]@echo off title Olan14's Better Server Status Checker :name cls if exist pingTrace.dat (goto :delpingTrace) else (goto :name) set /p name=Name? goto :main :delpingTrace del pingTrace.dat goto :name :delpingTraceTwo del pingTrace.dat goto :main :main cls if exist pingTrace.dat (goto :delpingTraceTwo) else (goto :main) echo Welcome, %name%. set /p IPname=What is the IP you would like to ping? echo Beginning Ping.... "%system root%\WINDOWS\system32\ping.exe" %IPname% -n 1 -w 1500 "%system root%\WINDOWS\system32\ping.exe" %IPname% -n 1 -w 1500 >> pingTrace.dat cls if exist "TTL=" > pingTrace.log (goto setvarone) else (goto setvarzero) :setvarone set %var%==1 goto :logping :setvarzero set %var%==0 goto :logping :logping if %var%==1 set status=Online if %var%==0 set status=Offline echo. %name% pinged %IPname% at %time% on %date% with its status being %status% >> ping_.log goto :result :result echo %name%, the IP you pinged, %IPname%, is %status%. echo Thank you! set /p go=Would you like to redirect to main?( yes and Yes to go to main, or no and No to exit)? if %go%==yes goto :main if %go%==no goto exit if %go%==Yes goto :main if %go%==No goto exit[/code]
I believe its crap. NO ONE better say you could of justused error levels to check if it was online or not. no. SUCCESFUL PINGS DON'T ALWAYS REPLY ERRORLEVEL=0. But succesful pings always replay with a timetolive at the end. :D

item.title: My lame IP pinger [BATCH]
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

ERRORLEVELS DON’T ALWAYS FUCKING WORK!
Ok, all successful pings do not come back with errorlevel=0.
But all successful pings will show their TTL at the end, so my prog logs the results, then searches if TTL is in the file where iits logged, and it only pings once so that it won’t confuse a successful ping with a messed up one.
Plus it deletes the log of the ping on arrival to :nam and :main.

Read full topic
